Full Job Description

Project Architect Job Description:

The Project Architect will be responsible for all phases of architectural design, production, and project management for small to mid-sized retail and commercial projects. As a Project Architect, you will be handling multiple projects simultaneously, that are all in different phases of the project design. You will assist in coordination of the project consultants as well as coordination with our in-house engineering teams.

Pay is DOE: $48 - $54+

What we offer at Barghausen:

401k plan with company match (current match is 200% of your first 4% deferral)
Medical, dental and vision healthcare + life insurance
At least 3 weeks of guaranteed PTO every year + 7 paid holidays
Competitive wages, bonuses, and performance-based incentives
Team bonding activities
Company paid gym memberships
Half-day Fridays during the summer months

Project Architect Responsibilities:

Client interface and coordination
Drive design, production, and delivery of projects
Guide the design team through the construction documentation and permit approval process
Conduct code compliance and quality control reviews of projects
Coordinate with consultants during all project phases
Ensure design control and construction administration of projects
Assist in the improvements of firm-wide documentation procedures and standards
Support project management in staffing, fee estimating and scheduling
Assist with proposals/budget development and project status updates
Provide technical guidance to project staff and share expertise and knowledge within the firm

Project Architect Requirements:

Bachelor's or master’s degree in Architecture preferred
Registered Architect in good standing required, NCARB preferred
Minimum of 5 years of experience working on all phases of architectural design, production and delivery and management
Proficiency in AutoCAD, Word, Excel and Revit - 3D rendering knowledge is a plus
Site Planning experience and strong design skills
Experience in a variety of projects (i.e. retail, commercial, industrial, multi-family, and mixed-use)
Strong presentation, oral and written communication skills

About Barghausen:

Barghausen Consulting Engineers, Inc. was established in 1982 and is one of the Northwest's leading multi-disciplined service firms offering civil engineering, land surveying, land use planning and other related services. We are a growing company with over 200 employees and an excellent reputation in the Puget Sound area. With the majority of our employees working from the Kent, WA office, we also have offices in Chehalis WA, Richland WA, Klamath Falls, OR, Roseville, CA, and Long Beach, CA. We work extensively throughout the Western United States and provide services in many other areas of the country. Our clients are mostly private developers and are some of the nation's largest and most respected homebuilders, industrial developers, retailers, and petroleum companies.

A leading architecture firm focused on urban design is looking for project architects.

Must be a licensed Architect

High level of analytical skills: Proficiency in using budgeting analysis (MS Excel spreadsheet creation), and doing code and zoning related research. Experience in getting previous work done on time and on budget is critical. Knowledge of how to create a design schedule is important, should be previously trained on a scheduling software program (MS Project)

Understanding of how long design and production tasks should take to be completed

Knowledge of how to measure up the consultants to ensure the project progresses smoothly

Should have a varied portfolio of past project types that can be drawn on while leading

Ability to mentor younger teammates to develop/exhibit good organization skills as well

Have a strong technical background in terms of materials knowledge, detailing, and systems coordination

Be willing to offer their best effort at all times, likely on multiple projects

Skillsets

MS Word document creation and writing skills. Effective letter writing, narrative writing, marketing pursuit writing skills

MS Project schedule creation and editing skills will be very important. Ability to develop a project timeline that can be maintained through the bumps and hurdles that happen in the design and construction of projects

MS Excel spreadsheet document creation and editing skills are needed to develop fees, revenue projections, etc.

Starbucks - Store Development and Design
Schedule
: Full-time
Pay Range : $105,300-$163,680
Bonus Eligible : Yes


From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrates coffee and its rich tradition, but also fosters a feeling of connection within every new community they served.



As the Architectural Program lead for store development, you will contribute to Starbucks success by leading a team responsible for advancing new store prototypes and expanding the design/construction standards used to scale innovation throughout our growing portfolio of stores. This individual will be charged with developing efficient, cost effective, scalable solutions that elevate Starbucks brand, enhance our customer experiences, and provide best in class environments for operators to work in.

Design and Construction Services – Manager Architecture

Oversees an evolving catalogue of architectural standards used to renovate and expand Starbucks portfolio of stores globally. Standards are inclusive of, and not limited to drawings, details, mechanical systems, functional design elements and specification.
Responsible for the development of archetypical solution used to launch initiatives, support emerging formats, and optimize project delivery.
Serves as a subject matter expert within store development to identify, document, and resolve architectural matters with various agencies having jurisdiction (health, fire, safety, etc.).
Provides oversite and advances the quality assurance program used to manage risk throughout our portfolio of standards
Contributes to the management of architectural outsourcing firms, defines services within our Master Service Agreements, engages in fee negotiations, and Consultant training.
Provides support for error & omission claims on behalf of Starbucks and collaborates with Legal to assist with project arbitration/litigation as required.
Provides design review assistance for ADA compliance, risk & safety assessments, and code variances.
Champions internal collaboration with business units to helping solve architectural issues that support Starbucks future growth.
Challenges and inspires teammates to achieve business goals. Engages in the development of direct reports through active mentorships.
Promotes a positive and successful attitude, encourages leadership, builds respectful relationships, and supports a “one team” mentality.

We’d love to hear from people with:

Bachelor and/or Master of Architecture, Interior Design, Construction management
Architectural license with a minimum of 10 years of experience (commercial/retail/restaurant practice a bonus)
5 years of experience as a project lead/mentoring project teams
General business experience in a large, matrixed organization
Experience and proficiency with building codes, Jurisdictional negotiations, architectural standards, building structures, consultant coordination, client management, construction best practices.
Demonstrated experience with sustainable design and technologies (LEED Accreditation)
Strong understand of the AIA contract documents inclusive of Owner/Contractor Agreements and Owners/Architect Agreements.
Advanced understanding of prototyping, and site adapt architecture practices.
Experience managing a team of direct reports, with the ability to lead, mentor, and inspire.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally, graphically, and in writing.
Ability to establish collaborative relationships with teammates, consultants, and vendors.
Working understanding of ACAD and Revit.

Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com.

Olson Kundig is a Seattle and New York City-based design practice founded on the ideas that buildings can serve as a bridge between nature, culture and people, and that inspiring surroundings have a positive effect on people’s lives. The firm’s work can be found across the globe, with projects as wide-ranging as huts to high rises, homes—often for art collectors—to academic, cultural and civic projects, museums and exhibition design, places of worship, creative production, urban design, and interior design.
Currently, we are seeking an Architect I who can help contribute to the overall excellence of work coming from Olson Kundig.
Must-haves –

Minimum 3- 5 years of post-bachelors degree Architecture firm experience.
Bachelor’s degree in Architecture or another related field.
Possess an innovative style and an interest in sustainable building performance and research and development
Experience with Revit is a must and experience with putting CD sets together
Should have good graphic skills and ability to perform analyses of design, planning, and occupancy studies and limited design layouts
Document project specifications and create reports, plans, estimates, and calculations

Personal Attributes –

Highly collaborative by nature, with the willingness to approach every project with creativity
An innate desire to produce meaningful work with strong design skills
Detail and task-oriented with a passion for excellence
Pro-active and dynamic in their skills and leadership

Nice to have –

Experience working with High-end residential mainly single-family homes, Hospitality (Hotels, F&B, and Resorts), Workplace.
Experience with tools such as SketchUp, Rhino

*
What can you expect from us?*

A creative work environment and colleagues who are collaborative, creative, and challenging
Opportunity to grow professionally with excellent projects
Check our culture page to learn about life at Olson Kundig

In addition to a dynamic and creative culture, Olson Kundig provides a generous benefits package that includes 16 days of paid time off, paid holidays, health plan, 401k match, bonuses, profit-sharing plans for qualified positions, a monthly travel subsidy for public transportation, and more.
COVID-19 considerations: Full COVID-19 vaccination required or an approved medical or religious exemption.
All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship and must already possess long-term work authorization.

Full Job Description
Company Description


We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.

IBI Group is now proudly a part of Arcadis. Together, we are committed to improving the quality of life for our clients, people, partners and the communities we all serve.



Job Description


We are committed to being a great place to work that fosters the professional growth of every individual through a relaxed, collaborative and dynamic work environment.

Our Transit group is an award winning mid-sized design studio dedicated to delivering creative public transit design solutions that elevate and strengthen the communities they serve.

We are looking for a Junior Architectural Designer / Intern Architect with an interest in complex projects from start to finish. The successful candidate will have a minimum of 2 years of experience in an architectural office and be an out-of-the-box thinker with a holistic understanding of the design process and a talent for developing creative design ideas. This is a great opportunity for a passionate and creative mind to take on dynamic and challenging projects and be part of creative design initiatives on transit projects both locally and internationally.

Most of the Things You’ll Work On:

Collaborating with a multi-disciplinary team (engineering, urban design and others) to support the design and construction of rapid transit projects in Canada and the United States.
Assist with creating and developing station designs, functional layouts, diagrams and presentation materials based on complex programming requirements including public and service areas.
Developing construction documents
Assisting in the construction administration phase: general review, site instructions, change orders and interpretation of contract specifications.
Assist the Senior team members with other tasks including updating logs and checklists


Qualifications


You'll need to have

Minimum Degree in Architecture
Minimum 2 years of experience in an architectural firm
Proficiency with Revit and BIM software, 3D Rendering, Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office
Well organized with the ability to manage time and deadlines in a fast-paced work environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Highly motivated with the ability to work independently within a collaborative team.
Proactive and detail oriented
Creative and collaborative with a passion for designing and detailing
Analytical thinker and problem solver
Desire to grow within a team environment
Experience in transit station design will be considered an asset
ALL CANDIDATES MUST SUBMIT A PORTFOLIO WITH THEIR CV/RESUME

Additional Information


Arcadis has officially purchased IBI Group and with this transaction now complete, IBI will now be known as Arcadis IBI moving forward. Please refer to our website for more information.

Located on the 10th floor of 801 Second Avenue, in the historic Norton Building with sweeping views of Puget Sound to the West and Mount Rainier to the South, IBI Group’s Seattle office is situated in the heart of downtown Seattle.

Seattle is known for its eclectic and energetic feel, with a wide range of neighborhoods that boasts: fine dining to trendy eateries, eye-catching art galleries and museums, and a walk on the beach a stone throw away – there’s something for everyone! The variety of transportation options makes getting around town a snap. Choose from Metro Buses, Link Light Rail or the Sounder Train. Seattle’s got you covered! Home of major tech companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and Expedia, Seattle is a leader in technology of the future – a true Smart City.

Why you should work for Arcadis IBI Group:

Our employees will find a design environment where collaboration is at the core of the business. We proudly support our team members through continuing education, completion of licenses and certifications, memberships in professional societies, seminar and conference attendance.

Competitive Base Salary based on industry standards
Robust Extended + Medical Benefits
Participation in Incentives Program
Remote Work Options or Hybrid WFH-Office Schedule
Coverage of Licensing Fees and Annual Dues to Professional Associations
Professional Development & Self-Directed Learning Resources

Arcadis IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We request applicants submit a RESUME highlighting relevant work experience; please limit PDF files to 10MB. For design related roles, we also require a portfolio to review.

An Architectural Associate I with Amento Group will develop valuable architectural technical skills while gaining both on-site and studio experience. You will have the opportunity to collaborate on a variety of project types with experienced professionals representing multiple aspects of the construction industry and will be rewarded with unique and valuable insight into the realm of Building Enclosure Design.

The ideal candidate will have a strong collaborative attitude and motivation to learn. Previous exposure to or a desire to learn Building Enclosure Design and the core concepts of Construction Administration are preferred

Effective verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to speak in front of others.
Work independently and as a part of a team.

Amento Group fosters professional intern development/AXP through mentorship and a variety of on-the-job experiences. The ideal candidate will have a strong collaborative attitude and motivation to learn. We are vested in our employees:

Planning for your future: We have a 3% match on 401(k) contributions, in addition to a yearly 401(k) profit sharing.

Vision insurance<

CR architecture + design is looking for a highly creative and detail-oriented Project Architect to join our retail studio in our Seattle office and help us deliver fast-paced projects located nationwide for a global retail brand.

__________________________

THE CHALLENGE

A Project Architect is a licensed professional primarily responsible for the coordination and development of design documentation for projects of various complexity/scope. Under general guidance and direction from a Senior Project Architect and/or Project Manager, a Project Architect is accountable for project delivery, including the assurance of technical quality and execution of tasks within the budgeted hours of the project and the scheduled timeframe, while adhering to client standards and design intent. A Project Architect leads, manages, and holds project team members accountable.

___________________________

Founded in 2011 by two Bellevue natives, we have grown to become the preeminent Eastside luxury home builder today. We truly get a thrill doing what we love most: building thoughtful homes that inspire community. Learn more about us and see our work at: https://mncustom.com
Why MN?
We pride ourselves on our empowered team environment and dedication to taking care of our people. We believe in setting you up to succeed with clear career progression, learning opportunities, and ownership of your role from the get-go. Accountability is huge for us and we place a lot of trust in our employees to do the right thing. We believe that a supportive and inclusive culture yields happy people, and happy people are the most successful at what they do.
About This Role
The Project Architect is responsible for designing single-family projects from beginning stages of design approval through permit submittal. Day to day, this role will create new luxury home designs, work with local jurisdictions on permitting, and research new market designs. Big picture, you will create and execute our home designs, expedite permitting and execute home completion. The Project Architect will partner with the Architecture team and the Director of Production Architecture to help build out the scalability of key functions and participate in exciting initiatives we’re bringing to MN!
On a given day, your work might include

Leading and performing the creation of BIM models and Permit Submittal Drawings for single-family residential projects

Ensuring quality and completeness standards

Partnering with the Architecture team to establish and maintain standards and procedures

Experience with construction administration or general contracting in a technical architectural capacity considered
Technical expertise in single-family residential architecture
Knowledge of building codes, standards, building construction, and building structures
Proficient with Autodesk Revit and Bluebeam
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite

New iPhone for your personal and business use
Complimentary snacks & beverages

Our team is a group of deeply authentic, mission-aligned people working to bring all-electric, sustainable, healthy housing to all income levels.

This is an exciting time to join our growing team! The construction industry is ripe for disruption and evolution. Leveraging our construction tech expertise and deep industry experience, our team is working on scaling construction technology to lower building costs, help decarbonize the built environment, and help our clients and partners achieve their development objectives for less time and cost.


Who we're looking for:

We seek an experienced Project Architect with a deep commitment to building sustainable and resilient homes and communities. This mission-aligned individual will bring enthusiasm for design, experience with getting jurisdictional approval and interest in advancing construction with technology and off-site manufacturing. In this position, you will lead the design, documentation, and construction administration of residential projects. In this role you will be on the frontline of integrating design and offsite manufacturing construction innovations. You will succeed in this position if you can bring attention to detail, an open mind, curiosity, and an ambition to grow and learn from others personally and professionally.




What you bring to the table:

5 to 8 years of professional experience in an architectural work setting
2 years minimum experience designing and documenting single family and/or multi-family residential projects
Hold a professional Bachelor or preferred, Master of Architecture degree
2 years minimum experience using Autodesk Revit in a production environment
Proficient in Autodesk Construction Cloud
Knowledge of the Seattle area Land Use Code and entitlement processes as it applies to single-family and multi-family residential projects
Experience working with the Residential Code, Building Code, Energy Code, and other applicable regulations
Must enjoy producing design and construction documents. Members of the Green Canopy NODE architectural team are both thinkers and doers who are involved in design decision making and in documenting those decisions.
Strong organizational and communication skills
Must be self-directed, curious, and must feel a sense of ownership and responsibility toward your work
Must work effectively within a collaborative team environment
Preferred: Architectural License
Preferred: Sustainable design certifications
Preferred: Experience with Sketchup
Preferred: Experience with MS Project



Primary Responsibilities:

Design and documentation:
Design: single-family and multi-family residential structures, including project concept, spatial relationship / layout, site design, exterior concept, and vertical alignment
Product integration: utilize internally developed products within designs in accordance with product parameters and constraints.
Building systems: accountable for the coordinating principal building systems, including mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems
Performance: ensure design, systems and material choices align with project and company energy and carbon goals.
Documentation: lead the design of the project and the production of drawings and other project documents
Manage:
Internal team: accountable for directing production of high-quality design documents per GCN standards
External consultants: accountable for obtaining proposals and contracts from design consultants; coordinate and review their work to ensure a cohesive design; ensure their work aligns to the project schedule and to GCN Standards; review consultant invoices
Schedule: create project schedules and coordinate internal and external resources to obtain entitlements and issue project documents per the project schedule
Cost: accountable for coordinating project design with the project budget
Information: accountable for coordinated information flow between the design team and other GCN teams and between GCN and external consultants and regulatory agencies
Entitlements: accountable for obtaining entitlements from regulatory agencies and utilities in a timely way
Neighbor / community relationship: attend community meetings or review community meeting notes, obtain easements and other agreements from neighbors
Construction administration: receive and process RFI's and other questions during construction
Collaboration:
Internal: inform ongoing process and quality improvement activities
Construction team: inform development of standard means and methods for high performance building
Research & Development: inform architectural aspects of prefabricated solutions
Company: provide information and co-develop ongoing process and quality improvement activities



Position and hours:

This is an Exempt, full-time position, working approximately 40 hours per week, typically 8AM to 5PM, Monday through Friday. Some required work may occur outside of typical office hours, such as community meetings, design review meetings, and interactions with neighbors.
This is a hybrid work position with an expectation of at least two days in the office per week.
Some travel to project sites, local authority offices or other special events may be required.



Compensation and benefits:

Starting salary range
Licensed: between $80,000 - $95,000 annually
Unlicensed: between $70,000 - $85,000 annually
Employee Stock Options
Starting annual PTO of 120 hours per year
Monthly Technology stipend of $50
Monthly Wellness stipend of $25
100% employer-paid health coverage for medical, dental, vision and basic life insurance for employees
Company-sponsored Employee Assistance Program
Company 401(k) plan
Company-paid parental leave for new parents
Leadership development and training for all employees

Position: Lighting Design Professional

Reports To: Electrical Department Manager

Classification: Exempt

Date of Revision: 7/2022

Summary

Lighting Design Professional –Plays a critical role on the design team having a minimum of six years of lighting design related experience. Understands all conventional aspects of lighting design. Independently performs a variety of assignments requiring the application of standard lighting design practice for a wide variety of project sizes. Offers lighting design expertise to a well- integrated design team spanning several offices that work on community-oriented architecture and design.

Requirements:

Essential Functions:

Performs luminaire selection, lighting calculations, lighting controls selection and application, creates specifications, review alternative solutions, provide pricing, and cost estimates, complete code compliance documentation, assists in bid phase, and construction administration
Fully integrated into the project design team, offering lighting design ideation, education, and advocacy
Responsible for producing lighting portions of construction documents for the project lead including but not limited to light fixture layouts, lighting control device layouts and associated energy code daylight zoning information.
Responsible to conduct field observations of existing facility lighting and control systems and create and/or assist in the creation of reports related to lighting
Responsible to research and document products, materials and/or construction installation methods.
Obtain and file support documents from manufacturers for items such as IES calculation files, product performance data, and other similar lighting design data
Effectively communicate with manufacturers, or their representatives, on products and installation guidelines and be able to capture and transfer that knowledge to other team members
Perform cost analysis for various options using standard construction economic fundamentals
Perform energy code analysis
Complete interior and exterior lighting calculations per industry best practices
Knowledge of general building construction practices and processes
Responsible to consistently capture the intended interior and exterior design vision of the overall project
Collaborate and peer review with lighting design team members
Construction Administration for assisting during the bidding phase as well as perform submittal reviews and provide responses to request for information (RFI) inquiries from the construction team.

Competencies:

Understanding how lighting design integrates into architecture, interior design, landscape, and construction practices.
Experienced with the lighting needs and design considerations of various building typologies including PreK-12, Higher Ed, and Healthcare Project types.
Understanding of the scientific principles of light and its application to the built human environment.
Able to communicate conceptualization and design concepts including clear graphic communication of design ideas
Keep required documentation for lighting specifications, code compliance forms, LEED, and WELL criteria.
Working knowledge of lighting technology, lighting controls, and calculation software such as AGi32, Dialux, Visual, or other lighting design software.
Good understanding of daylighting practices
Proficiency in Bluebeam preferred
Proficiency in Revit Documentation preferred
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suites a plus
Must independently apply sound understanding and judgement to visual, verbal, or written instructions
Ability to meet schedule deadlines and work within the project budget
Proficient organizational skills
Proficient verbal and written communication skills
Collaborative and professional work ethic

Job Description:




With preliminary direction from a licensed architect, participate and assist in pre-design/planning and all design phases of private residential design, multistory mixed-use housing, high-rise residential, corporate/commercial, retail, science & technology, corporate interiors, institutional buildings, and healthcare, including new construction, renovation, interiors, tenant improvement, parking garage, and unit plans; setup meetings with client representatives for presentations and workshops, analysis of goals and needs; collect, organize and analyze programming data including site information, building codes, zoning ordinances, and project budgets and schedules; develop space planning concepts and generate program documents based on clients' functional and spatial requirements; conduct site reconnaissance and investigations, and develop site design alternative studies; integrate projects into urban context, responsive to prevailing regulatory, environmental and economic conditions; collaborate on concept alternatives, studies and development requiring 3D digital massing, floor plans, space plans, building elevations, sections and perspectives; design exterior envelope as well as interior finishing requiring enlarged plans, elevations, sections, details and axonometric drawings; prepare client and public presentations, workshops and meetings, using 2D/3D CAD and building information modeling programs (such as Autodesk Revit, AutoCAD, Rhino, Grasshopper, SketchUp, 3D Studio Max, VRay, Lumion, and Enscape), analysis and computer skills to develop 3D building computer models and images, and presentation images; develop documents for all design phases, schematic design through construction documents including documenting architectural plans, elevations, and details in imperial or metric standards for jurisdictional agency corrections using 2D/3D modeling using Autodesk AutoCAD, Rhinoceros, Grasshopper, Autodesk Revit and related BIM, 2D and 3D Modeling software; produce design documentation and presentations with Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, PowerPoint, and free-hand sketching; build physical models using digital fabrication software, 3D printers, and laser cutter; organize, file and distribute documents utilizing Procore, Newforma software, BIM360 and other construction coordination software; work in conjunction with sustainable design leadership in the continued improvement and development of high-performance design to maintain and improve the quality and consistency of design environment and deliverables; prepare and incorporate weather data analysis to identify passive design potential based on the local climate and building use to minimize building energy needs and maximize the energy savings; prepare building energy models and daylight simulation using Energy Plus, Comfen, Diva, Archsim, HoneyBee, Ladybug, Dayism/Radiance and Ecotect to evaluate heating loads, cooling loads, the building’s overall energy performance, annual daylight availability and glare risk; set up automated parametric optimization workflows using available and custom developed scripts to connect 3D modeling tools, and optimize the building envelope; participate in research and selection of exterior and interior building materials and FF&E (Furniture, Fixtures and Equipment) components required for construction and work with consultants, vendors, product reps, and fabricators to meet overall project objectives; assist in reviewing accuracy of documents and resolving complex technical and design issues; participate in meetings with clients, consultants, contractors, and public agencies on a given project and coordinate for client and agency review and approval; coordinate design process from concept design through construction with mechanical, electrical, plumbing, fire protection (MEP/FP), civil, structural, lighting, A/V, telecom, food service/kitchen, sustainability, and landscape consultants to incorporate building systems into architectural designs to produce construction documentation and secure client and regulatory approval; apply architectural principles to review all related shop drawings, samples, mockups, and cut sheets on materials & equipment; assist in negotiating additions to the owner-architect agreement, evaluate and manage general contractor bids, estimates, and contract budgets, coordinating with project architects, project managers, clients, consultants, and contractors to respond to requests for information (RFI’s), submittals, clarifications, and modifications; review of structural construction for architectural coordination, HVAC system layout and installation, installation of lighting fixtures, and installation of electrical equipment; conduct regular site visits and progress meetings to observe construction progress and assist in preparing field observation reports, final inspections, punch lists, and certificates of substantial completion.

IA Interior Architects translates client goals, brand and culture into powerful environments built around people, processes, technologies and business drivers. Our clients in diverse markets worldwide require high-performance, visually compelling and sustainable environments to move their enterprise forward, support their culture, engage their staff, integrate technology and drive efficiencies. As architects, designers, workplace strategists and environmental specialists in the largest global architecture firm concentrating exclusively on interiors, we help clients articulate and align their business strategies and core values with the dynamic use of space.

We are presently searching for an engaging Design Director in our Seattle studio to help lead our Workplace interior architecture practice. As a Design Director, you will articulate and bolster an elevated design vision with staff, clients, and prospective clients, and ensure it is manifested in all project work, consistent with firm-wide design standards.

Specific responsibilities will include:

Monitors project design development. Oversees and at times executes design presentations.
Reviews and approves project space plans and selections of fixtures and finishes.
Introduces and advocates for innovative design concepts, staying ahead of interior design trends.
Promotes an integrated approach across IA’s practice areas including strategy, design, lighting, EGD, Workplace guidelines, and technical expertise.
Maintains awareness of overall project design budgets and works with Project Manager to monitor for profitability, scope adjustments, and schedule impacts.
Mentors and develops all Design staff; directly manages Senior Designers including providing project oversight and ongoing performance feedback, in addition to participating in employee performance reviews.
Initiates opportunities and leads efforts to educate office studio on design principles, innovation, trends.
Builds and develops client and business relationships, including identifying, pursuing and securing new opportunities.
Participates in design leadership forums across the firm to foster and promote design.
Stays actively engaged with the broader West Coast interior design community and professional associations through design thought-leadership, speaking opportunities, conference panels, and workshops.

REQUIRED EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE

Graduate of an accredited architecture or design school.
10+ years progressive experience working on commercial interior design projects.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Comprehensive knowledge of the commercial interior architecture and design industry.
Expert interior architectural detailing skills.
Comprehensive knowledge of working drawing techniques and procedures.
Thorough knowledge of building systems, codes and ADA requirements.
Comprehensive knowledge of design principles, practices and aesthetics including furnishings and equipment.
Deep understanding of and ability to articulate how design connects to strategy in the corporate workplace practice and how that can positively affect a client’s business and workplace design.
Highly developed presentation and graphic communication skills, including the ability to clearly communicate a design concept to designers, technical staff and clients.
Ability to lead and influence staff through a combination of professional savvy, personal charisma, and subject-matter expertise.
Working knowledge of budget preparation.
Advanced verbal and written communication skills.
Expert sketching and rendering skills.
Advanced Revit skills strongly preferred.
Advanced Adobe Suite skills.

WORKING CONDITIONS

All levels of Management staff have the same working conditions. For the majority of the time all staff will be working sitting in a studio with limited physical requirements. On occasion individuals will be required to visit a client site to perform site verifications and field surveys. This may require individuals to bend, stretch, twist and reach. The position is not subject to occupational and safety risks.

CR architecture + design is looking for an experienced and customer service oriented Project Manager to join our retail studio in our Seattle office and help us deliver fast-paced projects located nationwide for a global retail brand. This is the perfect opportunity for someone who enjoys a lot of client interaction and the ability to continue growing their client and team member leadership skills.

__________________________

THE CHALLENGE

A Project Manager is primarily responsible for managing all administrative and technical project efforts, serving as a primary client liaison, and actively engaging in key client relationships. A Project Manager is accountable for project success, including the technical quality, profitability, and execution of tasks within the budgeted hours of the project and scheduled timeframe, while adhering to client standards and design intent. A Project Manager leads, manages, and holds project team members accountable and supervises a small team of Designers, Architects, and Interior Designers.

___________________________

HOW YOU SUCCEED

Actively plan, organize, and direct the work throughout the life of the project, ensuring that the quality of construction documents meet the design intent and the project is successfully delivered to the client.
Determine the scope of work, estimate fees, and prepare proposals and contracts.
Establish and actively manage project budgets and schedules; ensure billable hours, team utilization, and financial goals are met; execute projects on-time while meeting all deadlines.
Actively manage resource allocation and planning.
Attend and present at client project meetings.
Actively seek business development opportunities with existing clients.
Provide consistent, clear, and effective communication to internal team members, clients, and external stakeholders.
Assist with training and mentoring junior team members.
Participate in employee interviews and performance management process.
Maintain regular, in-person and punctual attendance.

___________________________

WHAT YOU NEED

Bachelor's degree in Architecture or related field from an accredited institution along with 8 years of design and production experience is preferred; minimum of 5 years of design and production experience is required.
Minimum of 2 years of related project management experience within the architecture field; including the financial performance, resource planning, budgeting, forecasting, and client relationship management responsibilities is strongly preferred.
Retail project experience is strongly preferred.
Understanding of client expectations and the full life-cycle of projects and effective project management is required.
Demonstrated success building, nurturing, and fostering existing client relationships and motivating and leading internal teams is required.
Knowledge of building construction systems means and methods, materials, and industry standards is required.
Knowledge of Revit and/or AutoCAD with the ability to check the work of others for accuracy and completeness and manages time to meet project budget and schedule is required.
Experience utilizing project management software to track financial performance, resource planning, budgeting, forecasting, and approve timesheets is preferred.
Exceptional communications skills including written, verbal, and presentation are required.
Ability to effectively manage multiple deadlines and priorities is required.
Ability to participate and collaborate in a project team setting is required.
Ability to travel as needed is required.

___________________________

OFFICE AMENITIES

Our Seattle office is a one-of-a-kind space in a historic landmark, the Smith Tower. Located in the heart of Pioneer Square, you'll have free access to all this building has to offer
Stunning 360-degree water and mountain views, rooftop deck and lounge, historic Observatory and a new state-of-the-art fitness center and bike room, just to name a few
We designed our office space to pay homage to the neoclassical architecture of this iconic tower, keeping everything light, bright and full of character
Not to mention equipped with a rotating keg of craft beer for those long days...or just because.

__________________________

PERKS THAT WORK

Competitive Compensation & Bonus Plan • Competitive Benefit Plan • 401(k) Profit Sharing • Convenient Downtown Office Location • Parking/Transit Allowance • Career Tracks • Professional Development Allowance • Career Coaching • CR Offices Located Nationwide • Office Celebrations • Generous Paid Time Off & Holidays • Lunch-and-Learns • Employee Engagement & Wellness Programs • Tuition Reimbursement

Full Job Description

McLennan Design is a highly collaborative and dynamic team of professionals focused on merging design, building performance, and research. Our domestic and international work consists of architecture, urban design and interiors, sustainability consulting, and industrial design projects. The firm is anchored by Jason F. McLennan, founder of the International Living Future Institute, and Partner, Dale Duncan, with a combined vision to integrate environmental and social regeneration through net zero and socially just works. The ideal candidate should have passion, commitment and enthusiasm for these broad concerns and be equally capable of exploring them.

The offices of McLennan Design are located in the City of Bainbridge Island, Washington, and in the City of Kansas City, Missouri. Prospective employees ideally would be located in the Seattle area, although remote locations are possible.

Position Summary

The Regenerative Design Architect (RDA) provides leadership level sustainability consulting for the practice and project level working under the direction of the firm’s partners and in collaboration with the Director of Regenerative Design. This person is accountable to uphold the firm’s performance standards, process and vision, committed to developing the highest level of regenerative and living building, transformative design work. The RDA is responsible for the consistent delivery of the highest quality of sustainable documentation, consulting expertise, and the professional services required to support this level of work.

Qualities

A RDA must have proven project leadership, communication skills and experience guiding clients through the highest levels of regenerative design. This individual will need to demonstrate an emphasis and understanding of ‘deep green’ sustainability practices, including experience as a ‘deep green’ consulting leader in other firms. ‘Deep green’ experience is represented by leadership with Living Building Challenge work, LEED and other green building systems. This individual must demonstrate an expert level of knowledge in multiple areas of ‘deep green’ consulting, utilizing a variety of tasks ranging from materials research to energy performance consulting. The RDA must demonstrate an ability to guide multiple project teams at once.

Although not specifically required, advanced building performance analysis software, graphic design and computer drafting, including the capability to work with 3-D computer models in Revit, and to produce concept design deliverables and slide decks for presentation to clients, are all highly regarded skills for this position. The RDA will manage and guide additional team members in the research and development of detailed reports and presentations. It is essential that this individual be able to lead project team members and provide the motivation necessary for staff to do their best work without doing it for them. The RDA position requires collaboration, clear communicators, team building, and leadership. The RDA will need to be able to act independently, make timely decisions and exhibit the ability to coordinate and mentor less experienced staff.

Strong writing skills and the ability to compose compelling presentations are essential. The RDA must have the ability to think strategically and have demonstrated strong process skills for consistent delivery of thorough and high-quality sustainable design documentation, as well as administering all aspects of projects during each phase of the work. The RDA will be responsible for organizing and leading sustainable design eco-charettes and workshops. It is very important that this individual is comfortable and effective at leading client presentations and managing the client and consulting teams through all project milestones.

RDA Duties and Responsibilities

Leadership: Must encourage and participate in firm wide collaboration about issues related to regenerative design documentation, as well as partner with leadership on initiatives to enhance the quality of the firm regenerative design process.
Client Interaction: Must have the ability to interact comfortably and confidentially with clients, consultants, and other project members. Must have demonstrated the ability to understand and respect the values and objectives of clients, as well as their goals and constraints. Must demonstrate ability to make presentations to different client and stakeholder groups, and lead workshops.
Project Management: Must participate in and support the Firm Partners’ preparation, negotiation, administration, and execution of project agreements. Must have project management abilities to help support the project cost control and profitability and assist in monitoring the quality of the design documentation.
Office Culture: Must work together with leadership to foster innovation, creativity, and collaboration in ways that create the best possible environment for effective and creative project design and delivery and must work to build trust and team cooperation among office staff.

Knowledge, Skills and Education

10+ years of experience in the profession, post-graduation from an accredited institution.

A professional degree in architecture or related discipline

Experience in all phases and aspects of projects. Advanced knowledge of ‘deep green’ sustainability and regenerative design is required. Strong spreadsheet and work process skills and a current knowledge of Revit, InDesign, Adobe, and Power Point are also required. Previous supervisory experience is required.

Professional registration is required.

Experience in the sustainable design industry and an understanding of the Living Building ChallengeSM, and other green building systems is a requirement for this project leadership role.

Industry leadership level knowledge in a sub-set of areas is required, including: Climate Positive Planning, Biophilia, Biomimicry, Green Materials Selection and specification, Embodied Carbon, Energy Efficiency, Renewable Energy, Water and Waste Systems, Permaculture, Passive heating and cooling, Daylight Modeling, Natural Ventilation Modeling, Energy Modeling and more.

About J2:

Our Purpose: We provide Help, Hope, and Happiness to stressed building owners. We are Building Doctors. We diagnose, prescribe, and treat sick buildings. We know that unexpected or hidden building damage threatens your safety and your finances. Our team of professionals will diagnose the problem, prescribe the fix, and manage the treatment process to restore your safety and protect your investment.

Core Values:

Leadership: Provide direction, communicate, and deliver. Continuously.
Team: We, not me. We are a Team. I can’t do my job unless you do yours.
Integrity: Do the right thing, every time.
Improvement: We improve ourselves as well as the lives of those we serve.
Hospitality: We are a service business. We have a good bedside manner and know how to deliver difficult news.
Clarity: We communicate to clarity in all forms to provide understanding and transparency.
Joy: Bring the joy! Show up, be present, and have fun.
Family: We appreciate and serve our work, home, and client families.

Our multi-disciplined team performs assessments of existing buildings to diagnose performance issues and the cause of leaks and structural damage. Next, we provide repair scopes and design documents to effectively repair buildings. Then, we provide bidding and pre-construction services, work closely with contractors, and provide contract administration to guide owners through the repair process. We specialize in residential and commercial building envelope work ranging from apartments and condominiums, commercial, to high end residential.

We collaborate. We laugh. We work hard every day. We are technical, detailed and a little nerdy, but our ultimate goal is to bring help, hope and happiness to our clients that are facing financial burdens, safety concerns and the stress of living or working in buildings that need extensive repairs.

Job Description

We are seeking a qualified individual to join our team of professionals who provide inspections, design and construction administration during the repair process of buildings that are not performing properly. Nearly all of our work relates to the assessment of the building enclosure and repairs caused from water damage.

Our project managers are the main point of contact for our client to ask questions about their building repair project, managing contractors and other partners on the job, performing building envelope investigations, making presentations to the HOA board of directors, and supervising repairs to ensure quality workmanship.

Applicants must be self-motivated, willing to learn, have a strong work ethic, possess a customer service attitude and be able to perform the following job requirements.

Responsibilities:

Inspection of residential and commercial buildings. This may involve ladders, man lifts, scaffoldings, roof and crawlspace access
Knowledge of siding, roofing, weather-resistive barriers (WRB), flashings, waterproof membranes, etc.
Knowledge of wood framed construction assembly details
Proficiency in reading and understanding construction documents (plan and specifications)
Coordinate site inspections with building occupants, sub-consultants, contractors, and other related professionals
Document observed conditions (comprehensive field notes and photographs)
Draft summary reports of observations and findings
Develop a written Scope of Repair, solicit and facilitate bidding by qualified contractors of the approved Scope of Repair
Evaluate the received bids for responsiveness and make recommendations to the Client
Carry out periodic inspections and documentation of the ongoing repair work
Issue construction field directives for out-of-scope work, unforeseen conditions or to clarify the project design and specifications
Participate in and/or lead out project meetings
Communicate with clients and other design, insurance, surety, and legal professionals
Review and evaluate change order proposals and contractor's pay applications
Preparation and presentation of spreadsheets, graphical charts, reports and other written documents.

Qualifications:

Degree and/or license in architecture, engineering or construction management is a plus
Experience in construction field preferred
Experience as a building envelope consulting project manager preferred, but not required
Mandatory computer skills and knowledge of basic MS Office products
Hand’s-on roofing, siding, and other carpentry experience is a plus

Compensation will be determined on depth and experience within these requirements. Advancement opportunities are available and encouraged based on performance.

J2 offers a competitive benefits package including:  paid holiday - vacation - sick days, medical, 401k, other professional benefits, and a performance based profit sharing program.

We look forward to hearing from you!

To be considered for this position, please visit our careers page:

https://j2consultants.com/careers/

YA Engineering Services (YAES) is a rapidly growing national multi-disciplinary forensic consulting firm that includes structural, mechanical, electrical, and geotechnical engineering services; architectural and building envelope investigative services; non-destructive testing services; seismic risk assessment services; materials analysis services; expert witness and litigation support services; and accident reconstruction services. Role & Responsibilities:

Helps coordinate with clients to set up site visits and complete deliverables.
Manages project resources and sets/meets deadlines to ensure that projects stay on schedule.

Job Title

Project Architect

Life at PE

Perkins Eastman is a global design firm with expertise that covers all aspects of the built environment. With studios in 22 locations worldwide, we design to enhance the human experience and leave a lasting and positive impact on people’s lives and the world we inhabit.

VIA – A Perkins Eastman Studio is a strategic architectural and planning studio of Perkins Eastman with offices in Seattle, Oakland and Vancouver, BC. Highly networked across its offices, VIA is a highly interactive practice concentrated in urban planning, transit systems planning and the design of urban mixed-use developments. Our systems-level sustainable design strategies and community-based design studio set us apart from traditional architectural practice.

The Opportunity

VIA is seeking a Project Architect based in our Seattle office. We are interested in exceptional candidates with strong analytical and communication skills who are passionate and involved in community building at all scales. This person will work within our multidisciplinary team to coordinate and document multifamily residential and commercial projects with the opportunity to participate in public-sector infrastructure and urban design projects in the future.

Primary Responsibilities

Lead/assists a project team in development of the aesthetic and technical design and the preparation of architectural design and construction documents including drawings and specifications.
Keeps Project Manager and Principal in Charge informed of progress or need for assistance
Work in conjunction with the Project Architect who is responsible for the project.
Collaborates with or serves as the Project Designer for the design of the project.
Participate in Master Planning, Site Planning and Building Design exercises.
Develop and document design concepts and unique technical details.
Perform building code reviews to assure compliance.
Assist in the production effort on projects from the Pre-Schematic Phase through Construction Documents.
Coordinate the work of Consultants, reviewing and developing technical details and strategies that advance high performance design and systems integration, in support of sustainable design certifications.
Mentor junior staff.
Supervise or have the responsibility of the construction administration phase

Required Qualifications

Minimum Bachelor of Architecture degree
Minimum of 5 to 10 years of experience.
Dedicated team player, excellent communicator, possessing demonstrated skill at the execution of technically complex projects.
Strong skills in architectural design, documentation, and illustration.
Fluency in Revit 3D Building Information Modeling.
Skill in the management and coordination of project documentation and preparation of graphic presentation material.
Strong experience in the management of collaborative design disciplines, including integrated project delivery experience.
Thorough familiarity with the technical considerations involved in coordinating and executing Type 1 concrete high-rise residential buildings and also experience with Type 5 wood frame projects.
Passion for high quality sustainable design. Experience with sustainable building rating systems an asset.
Strong analytical and communication skills who are passionate and involved in community building at all scales.
Registered architect required
LEED AP preferred

How to Apply

If you would like to join a dynamic, energized, innovative and collaborative environment, where your ideas will be heard and your skills challenged, please visit our career page and apply with your cover letter, resume and/or portfolio (Adobe PDF preferred). No phone calls please.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

HYBRID SCHEDULE: MUST BE LOCAL TO AREA

APPLY HERE

The Senior Architect/Project Architect (PA) coordinates all technical and code aspects of a project with their team and works collaboratively with the Project Manager to maintain the project schedule and project budget. The PA oversees major deadlines and all deliverables and ensures that the QA/QC processes are closely monitored and closed out at every phase. They work closely with the Design Principal (DP) or Principal-in-Charge (PIC) to develop the project direction and implement design decisions.

The PA is involved in work acquisition through their participation in proposals, interviews, or by attending/speaking at conferences. This role is central to the firm’s completion of projects and the ideal candidate is passionate about architecture, has a developed design sensibility, and experienced technical abilities. The PA is also generally informed about project/marketing opportunities, construction cost trends, other significant projects inside and outside the firm, and is encouraged to be involved with professional organizations.

Responsibilities

TECHNICAL & DESIGN CONCEPTS LEADERSHIP

Develop design and technical solutions with the Principal and/or the design lead in a collaborative approach with all members of the team.

Implement design options and technical directions.

Review the technical specifications for completeness and accuracy.

PROJECT AND TEAM MANAGEMENT

Control project communication.

Oversee the production of project deliverables.

Participate in the QA/QC of the project.

Create and maintains staff responsibilities plan and deliverable ‘cartoon’ set.

Ensure the deliverables meet the contractual requirements at every phase of the project.

Review cost estimate and participate in VE process and cost reconciliation with the Project Manager.

Oversee consultant coordination and performance.

Oversee Construction Contract Administration process in collaboration with Project Manager.

OVERSEE PERMIT & CODE COMPLIANCE

Review code compliance

Coordinate permit deliverables with the AHJ

Control project documentation in collaboration with Project Manager

CLIENT RELATIONS

Participate in the consultant meetings and other critical project meetings

Professionally represent the firm to clients and maintain client satisfaction

Qualifications / Skills / Experience required

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in architecture.

Minimum 10 years of experience in a range of architectural skills.

Licensed to practice architecture in at least one 1 state.

Familiar or proficient with current versions of Revit BIM, Excel, Smartsheets and Microsoft Project.

Ability to work creatively in a collaborative environment during all phases of design.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Experience with K-12 projects a plus.

LEED certification or a strong understanding of sustainable design desirable.

Benefits

In addition to providing staff’s membership in professional organizations and attendance at educational programs, we offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefit package that includes the following.

401(k) retirement plan.

Employee sponsored medical (PPO and High Deductible with HSA), and dental and vision coverage.

Long-term disability insurance and, life insurance.

FSA plan with option for dependent care.

PTO and 9 paid holidays.

Flexible work arrangements.

In addition, Bassetti is proud to offer paid parental leave as we believe in offering equitable opportunities and sustaining our employees’ families.

Salary Range: $95,000 - 120,000

Sr. Project Designer (Salaried/Exempt Position)

Common and baseline responsibilities of a SR. PROJECT DESIGNER, include but are not limited to:

Responsible for leading all phases of the design process with a high level of proficiency and expertise while adhering to firm and project goals and standards of excellence in design, execution, and living design.

Initiates and creates schematic designs that optimize design solutions and plans with responsibility for presentation drawings, models, and narratives.
Promotes and manages overall project goals and constraints, including client values, construction and design budget limitations, and schedule requirements.
Evaluates design alternatives based on site and code requirements.
Expertly applies knowledge of building technology, building materials, construction methods, costs, and code to the design process.
Identifies and responds to technical implications and design decisions.
Prepares client presentation packages, external publications, and award submissions.
Plays essential role in marketing opportunities and develops successful client relationships for continuing business.
Uses graphic storytelling to advance the project delivery and scope.
Reviews work for accuracy, omissions, legibility, and for document compliance in accordance with the Project Delivery Manual.
Leads collaborative teams in internal design reviews, charettes, and pin-ups and external community engagements.
Demonstrates strong and effective communication and direction which inspires high team performance and design ideas.
Mentors staff.
Accountable for effective coordination with partners and consultants throughout the schematic and design development phases.

Requirements:

Professional degree in architecture or related discipline
Professional architectural license or 25 years of experience in the design profession.
15+ years of professional experience.
LEED project experience necessary.
Advanced knowledge of architecture and design concepts, practices, and methods.
High level of creativity, innovative thinking and problem solving.
Experience directing or coordinating work efforts of emerging staff.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Collaborative and professional work ethic.
LEED GA or within 6 months of hire.
Professional Accreditation in one area of Living Design that interests you:
LEED AP with Specialty, BREEAM AP, WELL AP, SITES AP, CPHC/CPHE Passive House Institute Certified Passive House, or RELi AP

JOB SUMMARY:

The Assistant Project Manager (APM) is responsible for assisting the Project Manager in managing a smooth, profitable, and efficiently run PM Design Group (PMDG) project team. The basic function of the Assistant Project Manager is to assist with the planning, organizing and monitoring the development and completion of assigned projects of PM Design Group, provide leadership when needed and be responsible in the following areas: • Successful Multiple Project • High Management Level Client Interface & Reporting • Project Profitability & Budget Control • Project Quality • Business Development Activities • People Management (when assigned staff) The Assistant Project Manager may also complete the duties of a Sr. Job Captain or Job Captain when circumstances and/or resources dictate.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBIITIES:

1. Complete business development (marketing) activities as assigned to secure client business.

2. Oversee staff assigned to projects team.

3. Respond to clients (in person and over the phone).

4. In conjunction with Project Manager, review proposals prior to approval and client submittal

5. Assist Project Manager to forecast resources (labor, consultants, etc.)

6. Ensure project team is adequately staffed for assigned projects.

7. Must abide by the Employee Manual, all company policies, and ensure PMDG employees do the same.

8. Regularly review the status of projects, project budgets and project reporting, and proactively take action when budgets are in jeopardy of not being achieved.

9. Act as a primary referral/resource with other PMDG employees, and/or outside consultants.

10. Oversee the Human Resources requirements (hiring, firing, evaluating, and disciplining) of the project team and coordinate with Director of HR.

11. Continuously mentor PMDG employees to improve their skill set.

12. Set the tone for the office and project team and promote a “client-centered” attitude throughout.

13. Provide technical assistance to PMDG employees as required.

14. Ensure all assigned projects are completed to the company’s quality standard level(s).

15. Seek out resource-sharing opportunities to ensure PMDG employees remain billable to a client project.

16. Review and approve timecards for assigned employees or help PM when needed.

17. Review Accounts Receivable & Accounts Payable over 60 days and follow-up as required.

18. Coordinate with Corporate Accounting as directed by Project Manager.

19. Attend and actively participate in company meetings/conference calls.

20. Look for opportunities to reduce/eliminate unnecessary expenditures.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess a valid Driver’s License and an acceptable driving record.
Must possess a working knowledge of Office Suite of products.
Must possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to influence others.
Must be able to clearly communicate verbally and in writing in English.
Must be an excellent company ambassador at all times.
8 – 10 years industry experience, with a minimum 5 years supervising others.
Licensed Architect preferred, though not required.
Must possess excellent negotiation and closing skills.
Must be able to perform and comprehend business calculations, spatial comprehension, and understand financial/operational reports.

Exponent is a leading engineering and scientific consulting firm that brings together more than 90 different disciplines to solve the most pressing and complicated challenges facing stakeholders today. Our vision is to engage the brightest scientists and engineers to empower clients with solutions for a safe, healthy, sustainable and technologically complex world. We leverage over 50 years of experience in analyzing accidents and failures to advise clients as they innovate their technologically complex products and processes, ensure the safety and health of their users, and address the challenges of sustainability.

We employ experts with degrees from top programs at over 500 universities and extensive experience spanning a variety of industries. We are expanding and are excited about your interest in joining our team!

Key statistics:

1100+ Team members
900+ Consultants
550+ Ph.D.s
30+ Offices globally

We are currently seeking a Senior Managing Engineer/Architect (Building Technology) for our Buildings & Structures Practice in Seattle, Washington. In this role, you will work as part of a team to help lead and further grow our engineering/architectural consulting services regionally and will be a key member of our national practice. Responsibilities will include marketing to new and existing clients, successfully executing projects, and recruiting, hiring, and retaining highly qualified staff.


You will be responsible for:

Inspection, analysis, and determination of root causes of building envelope and building material failures.
Developing a profitable and dynamic Buildings and Structures consulting practice based in Exponent’s Seattle office
Collaborating with our Materials and Corrosion Consulting practice with a particular focus on expanding client relationships in the local market
Identifying, developing, and securing new business opportunities and promote Exponent through typical business contacts
Recruiting, developing, and mentoring staff in the areas of architectural and structural engineering, failure analysis and investigation, and both domestic and international dispute resolution
Promoting Exponent's expertise in architectural and structural engineering by meeting with potential clients, presenting at conferences and conducting seminars

You will have the following skills and qualifications:

M.S./Ph.D. in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering or degree in architecture
P.E. or S.E. license in the States of Washington and Oregon.
Proven business development and client management track record, and the ability to attract projects to support full-time staff
An outstanding professional reputation with an existing client base
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong leadership skills and the ability to support multiple group projects
Strong desire to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and exciting consulting environment

Please visit the following link to learn how Exponent and our staff are making an impact: https://info.exponent.com/our-impact

Our firm is committed to offering a variety of programs and resources to support health and well-being. We believe that providing competitive benefits as well as compensation and recognition programs empowers our staff to do work that makes a difference.

Exponent is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.

Arcadis IBI Group's Seattle WA office is in search of an Architect / Designer to join their team and support their Living + and Learning+ projects. You will need to be local to Seattle WA, and able to work remotely until we return to the office.

Develop designs from concept through design development to contract documents

Qualifications

University Degree – Bachelor / Master of Architecture
Registered Architect or Pursuing Licensure in a US jurisdiction
Minimum of 5 years experience in an Architectural Design firm
Strong technical knowledge of building construction and thorough understanding of construction documents
Proven ability to collaborate in visioning, design, synthesis, and delivery roles

Comfortable communicating with clients/consultants

Our office we're located on the 10th floor of 801 Second Avenue, in the historic Norton Building with sweeping views of Puget Sound to the West and Mount Rainier to the South, IBI Group’s Seattle office is situated in the heart of downtown Seattle.

Leadership

Management

BHC Consultants is a consulting engineering, planning, and building code and construction compliance firm with offices in Seattle, Tacoma, Bellingham, and Spokane Washington. We are currently seeking a full-time Senior Project Engineer/Project Manager or Senior Project Architect/Project Manager with experience in solid waste facility design to join our engineering group in one of our three office locations. Collaboration with staff in all offices should be expected; preferred location can be prioritized.

BHC is a growing firm with a significant backlog of municipal consulting services contracts for cities, counties, and special purpose districts in the Northwest, supported primarily by Western Washington clients. We are proud to be an employee-owned and managed consulting firm committed to the development and retention of our employees within a positive, collaborative, and challenging work environment. We are committed to a healthy work-life balance for all staff and offer the flexibility to achieve that balance.

BHC has a long history of assisting many different municipal clients in the Pacific Northwest with solid waste facility needs including planning, alternatives analysis, design, support during bidding, services during construction, assistance during operation, permitting, and on-call support. BHC has developed one of the most experienced municipal landfill design practices in the Pacific Northwest with projects in Washington, Oregon, Alaska, and Nevada. The ideal candidate would be able to develop more work on solid waste transfer stations, materials recovery stations and other related facilities.

The Sr. Project Engineer(Architect)/Project Manager will:

Play a key role in the continued growth of the company by helping to maintain relationships and manage projects with existing clients and helping to develop new clients and transfer station design projects.
Demonstrate work experience in solid waste facility engineering, primarily focused on design of transfer stations and resource recovery facilities, but also demonstrate an understanding of related leachate, landfill gas, landfill, and related engineering design aspects.
Be primarily responsible for executing projects involving solid waste facilities, but also be flexible in working on other civil engineering projects based on workload and project needs.
Demonstrate strong project management skills including the ability to develop scopes of work, budgets, and schedules during project planning, and the ability to deliver quality projects on time and within budget.
Independently coordinate staffing and workload throughout entire project development and ensure completion of deliverables on schedule.
Track financial aspects of projects and coordinate and adjust work effort with the team to ensure that work is completed.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor of Science (Civil or Environmental Engineering is preferred.) or similar Architecture credentials
Licensed Professional Engineer. State of Washington PE license required within 6 months of date of hire. Licensed Professional Architect, State of Washington license required within 6 months of date of hire is acceptable.
10+ years demonstrated success working on multi‐disciplinary engineering or architecture projects.
Demonstrated success working on transfer station and other solid waste facility projects including masterplan development, permitting, design, evaluation of operations, and providing services during construction.
Strong technical leadership, mentoring, and project management background.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
A positive attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee‐owned culture.
Proficient with MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and MS Project.
Familiarity with bluebeam or other pdf markup tool

The following would also be of benefit:

Working knowledge of AutoCAD, AutoCAD Civil 3D, and/or Revit (BIM) design software products
Experience with solid waste facility operating procedures and practices
Master’s Degree
Professional society involvement
Established clientele and professional relationships
Project management training, PMP certification, or similar technical design leadership

We Offer:

Generous total compensation package
Monthly commute/home office stipend for transportation, parking, home office expenses
Monthly cell phone stipend with business necessity
100% company paid employee Health, Life, and Disability insurance
60% company paid dependent Health Insurance
50% company paid dependent Dental Insurance
Health Savings Account and Flexible Spending Account options to achieve tax savings
Flexible schedules
Reimbursement for professional registrations/renewals and approved training/conferences
Paid memberships in professional organizations
Employee referral bonus program
Career guide mentorship program
Paid time off (sick, vacation, holidays, and volunteer day)
We offer broad based company ownership to employees at all levels, with no majority owners, and where everyone can share in the benefits of ownership. This model is unique to BHC and gives us local control, ease of leadership transition, flexibility, and the freedom to control our destiny.
